description.value:
@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.PkYYoSwGjKt9BiTo]{Weapon Group: Melee Weapons}

Fighting knife bayonet 25 1d6 piercing 2 lb. Finesse, light, undermount

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.qB35DS5654aWtgir]{Finesse} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.bY9owuVfWrNWp8NV]{Light} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.ndsgjoLFhH09eWJa]{Undermount} A short metal blade mounted to aa firearm.

A weapon with AP rounds gains the AP property.

Use: Caseless rounds, ESP bullets, gauss iron flechettes, sabot SPPs, traditional bullets, heavy shells.

Cost: x5 regular ammo price

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.iK2nOll8s5dIVgVp]{AP (Armor Piercing)}

This weapon ignores a target's resistance to the weapon's damage type (e.g.: a piercing weapon ignores resistance to piercing). If the target has fantasy damage resistances, the weapon also counts as magical, silver, and adamantine.

If an opponent has immunity to the weapon’s damage type and the weapon has the AP property, the opponent has only resistance to that weapon instead of immunity.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: 1d12 and up

Large and larger targets suffer neither damage nor any effect. Medium and smaller targets suffer 1 hit point of damage (which cannot be modified) and disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn. A critical hit causes the target to be stunned until the start of your next turn.

Use: Caseless rounds, ESP bullets, sabot SPPs, shotgun shells, traditional bullets.

Requirement: Non-auto or non-auto-heavy.
Cost: x3 regular ammo price

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: Any

If you suffer disadvantage from firing at a target at long range and miss with your attack, on your next attack, you no longer suffer disadvantage. You also suffer -2 damage on each damage die.

Use: Caseless rounds, ESP bullets, gauss iron flechettes, sabot SPPs, traditional bullets;

Requirement: Auto or auto-heavy weapons only.
Cost: x4 regular ammo price

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.HU4lNUAme2XmxfAN]{Weapon Group: Small Arms, One-Handed}

The air-dart gun resembles a standard pistol except it fires a small needle via an air compressor. The needle inflicts no damage but can deliver any number of medical injections. You choose which injection to employ from your inventory before making the attack.

Air dart pistol 150 Special 20/100 4 lb. Light, loading, undermount

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.bY9owuVfWrNWp8NV]{Light} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.z2wFzTqhwoovc1Su]{Loading} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.ndsgjoLFhH09eWJa]{Undermount} 

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.COmZhW4Lv2ooxdha]{Injections}

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.BQP0JrEgTyjtdfeP]{Injection: Detonator} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.QVECnRPFw6bWeApT]{Injection: Fear}

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.XAHL7HYIUyXfqDRe]{Injection: Narcosynthesis} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.TDArmghJNhkA0nri]{Injection: Open Mind}

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.VPsyClC1jtgkHZLK]{Injection: Pain} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.4rQuCDklVwdjOiiY]{Injection: Paralysis}

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.AYldDF83Rc6PNedU]{Injection: Slow} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.AYldDF83Rc6PNedU]{Injection: Slow}

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.Fim0r8kwu9pO2qPe]{Weapon Group: Small Arms, Two-Handed}

Assault rifle 300 1d8 piercing 100/400 7 lb. Auto (1d10), reload (50 shots)

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.450g1kbvRQoe1x5P]{Auto 1d10} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.HE1gIc0o7bZeLjFT]{Burst Fire}

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.QjoW3JNAsq3eJt4s]{Reload 50 shots}

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear}

Ranging in size from small and concealable to large and clumsy, binoculars bring distant objects into close focus. They are sturdy, waterproof, and survive falls up to 50 feet. If broken, they cannot be repaired.

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-equipment.ZQyIaZLxh6RhmN2h]{Battry Cell, Basic}

This detonator can be programmed to detonate the moment a pecific monster enters its blast radius. It can also be programmed to detonate for everything but specific people. There is no limit on its parameters, but setting the programming requires at least one minute.

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear}

After the safety is pulled, impact triggers detonate upon impact with any rigid surface. This detonator is rarely used except with grenades.

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-equipment.ZQyIaZLxh6RhmN2h]{Battry Cell, Basic}

These unique detonators only function on explosive payloads of 5 lbs. or less. When armed, the detonator detects any sizeable metallic object (such as a vehicle, exo-armor, or suit of plate) passing within 30 feet and is pulled (together with its explosive) towards it, detonating on impact. If there is any form of cover or impedance, the detonator stops but still detonates.

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-equipment.ZQyIaZLxh6RhmN2h]{Battry Cell, Basic}

This detonator detects movement in its burst area and detonates regardless of the target.

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear}

These trigger the moment a weight is pressed upon the detonator. Large and larger targets automatically trigger pressure detonators upon entering a square containing one. Medium and smaller targets have a 50% chance to avoid the sensor unless the person placing the explosive succeeded on an DC15 Intelligence (Demolitions) check for proper placement. The sensor can be manually adjusted to only detonate for specificsized targets (e.g.: detonation only for Huge targets).

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-equipment.ZQyIaZLxh6RhmN2h]{Battry Cell, Basic}

This simple form runs an electrical pulse that triggers the mechanical, chemical, or electrical detonator. The maximum range of any wired detonator is 2,000 feet.

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear}

This detonator is a simple mechanical or chemical trigger attached to an explosive with a trip wire: a creature passing through the wire pulls the pin and detonates the device. You can run up to 25 feet of wire but the detonation only occurs in the square where the explosives are placed. Because the wire needs to be raised to be triggered, there is a DC20 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot the wire.

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear}

Timers utilize a mechanical clock to countdown compared to a digital timer. Although one may purchase a RDR (red digital readout) for the same price, this makes the detonator a TL2 item. The actual trigger is usually chemical or mechanical.

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-equipment.ZQyIaZLxh6RhmN2h]{Battry Cell, Basic}

The range limit of a radio remote is 5,000 feet. Both the transmitter and receiver require batteries.

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.WklldBUUO3oesibI]{UM5 Ch.6: Granades & Explosives} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.a6bTH9RIOA1gwoza]{Grenade}  @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.tyqnHVNxWuUF1jDk]{EXP (Explosives)} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.C9Q3Yg0CgOm7Ty1N]{(EXP) Concussion} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.oaLjWnlYGoulu7oy]{Tech Level 1}

This light explosive uses air pressure as well as shrapnel to disrupt enemy lines. They are often employed as mines and in air bursts to break up dense collections of personnel.

 Targets with 10 hit points or less that fail the saving throw are killed.

Concussion 1d6 Physical 5 ft. ½ lb. 10 1 No Detonator

Physical

Grenades and explosives with the physical damage type deal bludgeoning damage unless otherwise stated. Medium or smaller targets that don't save against the Dexterity saving throw are knocked prone by the explosion.

data.chatFlavor: @Compendium[combat-utility-belt.conditionsdnd5e.ekm4TUHKT3QUPdPv]{Prone} if targets fail the Dex saving throw. @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.C9Q3Yg0CgOm7Ty1N]{(EXP) Concussion}: Targets =<10 HP that fail the saving are killed.

description.value:
@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.WklldBUUO3oesibI]{UM5 Ch.6: Granades & Explosives} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.a6bTH9RIOA1gwoza]{Grenade}  @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.tyqnHVNxWuUF1jDk]{EXP (Explosives)} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.xTJEQZpGy8acbzHz]{(EXP) Frag (Fragmentation)} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.oaLjWnlYGoulu7oy]{Tech Level 1}

Frags are designed purely as an antipersonnel explosive by discharging dozens of plastic or steel flechettes blowing out along with fragments of the explosive's own shell. This deadly shrapnel shreds anything it touches (dealing bludgeoning, piercing, AND slashing damage).   

Fragmentation 1d8 Physical 10 ft. ½ lb. 25 1 No Detonator

Physical

Grenades and explosives with the physical damage type deal bludgeoning damage unless otherwise stated. Medium or smaller targets that don't save against the Dexterity saving throw are knocked prone by the explosion.

data.chatFlavor: @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.xTJEQZpGy8acbzHz]{Frag} deadly shrapnel shreds anything it touches (dealing bludgeoning, piercing, AND slashing damage).

description.value:
@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.WklldBUUO3oesibI]{UM5 Ch.6: Granades & Explosives} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.a6bTH9RIOA1gwoza]{Grenade}  @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.tyqnHVNxWuUF1jDk]{EXP (Explosives)} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.zgyP1fMQAonWXbqW]{(EXP) Flashbang} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.oaLjWnlYGoulu7oy]{Tech Level 1}

Also simply referred to as a stun grenade, a flash bang reduces the combat effectiveness of opponents by confusing and disorientating them with a sudden blinding magnesium flash and a deafening blast. The grenade body doesn't actually fragment so no shrapnel is dispersed.

Targets that fail the save are blinded and deafened until the end of your next turn.  

Flashbang Special Special 10 ft. ½ lb. 25 1 No Detonator

data.chatFlavor: @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.zgyP1fMQAonWXbqW]{Flashbang} Dex save or blinded and deafened until the end of your next turn.

description.value:
@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.WklldBUUO3oesibI]{UM5 Ch.6: Granades & Explosives} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.a6bTH9RIOA1gwoza]{Grenade}  @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.tyqnHVNxWuUF1jDk]{EXP (Explosives)} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.5p3UjT3tUP0z1oCf]{(EXP) EMP} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.wbgddINY6cseqVgE]{Tech Level 3}

EMPs don't inflict any damage, but instead discharge an electromagnetic burst that disrupts electronics.

When detonated, all technology that employs a cell suffers stop functioning for [[1d4]] minutes. Vehicles suffer disadvantage on Dexterity checks for [[1d4]] minutes.

EMP None None 15 ft. ½ lb. 100 3 No Detonator

data.chatFlavor: @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.5p3UjT3tUP0z1oCf]{EMP} All technology with 15-ft radius stops functioning for [[1d4]] minutes. Vehicles suffer disadvantage on Dexterity checks for [[1d4]] minutes.

description.value:
@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.WklldBUUO3oesibI]{UM5 Ch.6: Granades & Explosives} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.a6bTH9RIOA1gwoza]{Grenade}  @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.tyqnHVNxWuUF1jDk]{EXP (Explosives)} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.6mwuvYMwCZg5yRvC]{(EXP) H.E.A.T.} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.iK2nOll8s5dIVgVp]{AP} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.oaLjWnlYGoulu7oy]{Tech Level 1}

Or high-explosive anti-tank, HEAT is able to generate extreme temperature in a focused burst, compromising virtually any defense. When focused into a shaped charge, a HEAT weapon is the greatest threat to armored opponents.

HEAT explosives have the AP property, and also count as fire and radiant against targets resistant to those types.  

HEAT 2d6 Physical 5 ft. ½ lb. 45 1 No Detonator

Physical

Grenades and explosives with the physical damage type deal bludgeoning damage unless otherwise stated. Medium or smaller targets that don't save against the Dexterity saving throw are knocked prone by the explosion.

@Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.R1ew21i3luHJHfV5]{UM5 Ch.6: Gear} @Compendium[foundryvtt-compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-rules.oW9iuEoxWvtPKvDo]{UM5 Ch.6: Tech Level 0-5}

No paper, needles, or wire; this device is a simple palmshaped item that is placed gently on the subject’s body. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks on the target. Each attempt uses a charge.

The potion is separated into brown, silver, and gray layers resembling bands of stone. Shaking the bottle fails to mix the colors.

When you drink this potion, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed for 1 hour. During this time, you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks you make to climb.

The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 2d4+2 hit points when you drink this potion.

The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Cold type damage for 1 hour.

The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Lightning type damage for 1 hour.

Its cloudy green fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.

You can breathe underwater for 1 hour after drinking this potion.

The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Fire type damage for 1 hour.

The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 4d4+4 hit points when you drink this potion.

The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Radiant type damage for 1 hour.

The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Psychic type damage for 1 hour.

The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Poison type damage for 1 hour.

The red in the potion’s liquid continuously expands from a tiny bead to color the clear liquid around it and then contracts. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

When you drink this potion, you gain the “enlarge” effect of the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.WahI41a3goVUg0x1]{Enlarge/Reduce} spell for 1d4 hours (no concentration required).

The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Force type damage for 1 hour.

This potion’s transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type.

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 21 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

Agitating this muddy liquid brings little bits into view: a fish scale, hummingbird tongue, a cat claw, or a squirrel hair.

When you drink this potion, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.hDOENzjuj5WpLq7B]{Animal Friendship} spell (save DC 13) for 1 hour at will.

activation.condition: Beast must have an Intelligence of 3 or lower.

description.value:
This concoction looks, smells, and tastes like a potion of healing or other beneficial potion.

However, it is actually poison masked by illusion magic. An identify spell reveals its true nature.

If you drink it, you take 3d6 poison damage, and you must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. At the start of each of your turns while you are poisoned in this way, you take 3d6 poison damage. At the end of each of your turns, you can repeat the saving throw. On a successful save, the poison damage you take on your subsequent turns decreases by 1d6. The poison ends when the damage decreases to 0.

Foundry note: to apply the reduced damage from a successful Constitution save, please use the Other Formula (set at 1d6) as required.

The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Necrotic type damage for 1 hour.

The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Thunder type damage for 1 hour.

The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Acidic type damage for 1 hour.

This potion’s transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type.

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 23 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 8d4+8 hit points when you drink this potion.

The potion’s dense, purple liquid has an ovoid cloud of pink floating in it.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{Detect Thoughts} spell (save DC 13).

The red in the potion’s liquid continuously contracts to a tiny bead and then expands to color the clear liquid around it. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

When you drink this potion, you gain the “reduce” effect of the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.WahI41a3goVUg0x1]{Enlarge/Reduce} spell for 1d4 hours (no concentration required).

This potion’s transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type.

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 23 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

An eyeball bobs in this yellowish liquid but vanishes when the potion is opened.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL]{Clairvoyance} spell.

This potion’s transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type.

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 25 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

This potion’s container seems to hold fog that moves and pours like water.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.2IWiZAJtOGDoKjiz]{Gaseous Form} spell for 1 hour (no concentration required) or until you end the effect as a bonus action.

This blue potion bubbles and steams as if boiling.

For 1 hour after drinking it, you gain 10 temporary hit points that last for 1 hour. For the same duration, you are under the effect of the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.8dzaICjGy6mTUaUr]{Bless} spell (no concentration required)

Foundry note: the Other Formula button can be used to roll the bonus 1d4 received from Bless.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

merchant.playersPermissionDescription: Observer (access to sheet but can only purchase items if merchant sheet type)
